intro: Batocydia unguis, commonly known as the clawed liverwort, is a small, mat-forming liverwort that thrives in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its intricate, leaf-like structures called thallus. The plant exhibits a distinct morphology with lobed, often claw-shaped leaves that give it its common name. It is typically found on rocky surfaces or in damp soil, often in temperate regions. Due to its delicate nature, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of environmental conditions.
